body: Perhaps devise should look first at `Rails.application.secret_key_base` (which is set in 5.2.0.beta2) prior to looking at `Rails.application.secrets[:secret_key_base]`

rename.from: Missing devise secret key with Rails 5.2.0.beta1
rename.to: Missing devise secret key with Rails 5.2.0.beta2

issue.title: Support for :credentials on Rails v5.2.x.

repository.name: devise
repository.description: Flexible authentication solution for Rails with Warden.

issue.body:
This fixes #4710.

Rails introduced :secrets in v5.1. They somehow changed it to :credentials. This fix represents this change.

Devise will now look :credentials first, then fallback to :secrets for 5.1.x compatibility then it will check for standard secret key. If three not found then exception will arise.

body: I've sent a PR. That PR will solve this problem.

issue.title: Rails 5.2 issues

repository.name: learn-rails
repository.description: An example Rails 5.1 app to accompany the "Learn Ruby on Rails" book.

issue.body:
Rails 5.2 beta is out and I tried generating the 'learn-rails' example application with Rails Composer. It fails because The file _/config/secrets.yml_ does not appear to exist. Note that Rails 5.2 no longer uses the _/config/secrets.yml_ file. We'll have to change the 'learn-rails' example application and rewrite Book Two to use the new Rails 5.2 [Encrypted Credentials](https://www.engineyard.com/blog/rails-encrypted-credentials-on-rails-5.2) feature. See https://github.com/RailsApps/rails_apps_composer/issues/366

Also it looks like Devise (authentication) will fail with Rails 5.2. See https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/4710

body:
Before this change is released (as of today it still seems to be an issue), you can try:

```ruby
# config/initializers/devise.rb
...
config.secret_key = Rails.application.credentials.secret_key_base
...
```

Update for Rails 5.2.0.rc1

Make sure your master_key hasn't changed after upgrade. That file is not tracked in Git.


... (previous comment is no longer valid, deleted).
@januszm, I am checking this at the moment and will report back with a merge if necessary.

@januszm, I double checked with Rails v5.2.0-rc1.

`$ bundle exec rails credentials:edit`

Output:

```
# aws:
#  access_key_id: 123
#  secret_access_key: 345

# Used as the base secret for all MessageVerifiers in Rails, including the one $
secret_key_base: fd48be30aa33f5934ef1178c3f83221de9b6b58418f7270dbd6b4fed5d8d2139f762c975d05a2e3db470b31a227efc6c15185a94ff9ab10f7917e22804ca31da $
```
...Let's check the values if correctly loaded to devise:

```
$ puts app.credentials.secret_key_base
> fd48be30aa33f5934ef1178c3f83221de9b6b58418f7270dbd6b4fed5d8d2139f762c975d05a2e3db470b31a227efc6c15185a94ff9ab10f7917e22804ca31da #correct

$ puts app.secret_key_base
> cab7d1f9e4d2e0540d1620a9f6eba187 # wrong
```
Are you sure this has changed on 5.2.0-rc1? I see nothing has changed.

Attn: @tegon 

Additional note: If you mean outside of devise, like `Rails.cre...` than my test does not cover that part. And sorry for the misunderstanding.

@gencer you're right, it was a different issue on my end, upgrade from Rails 5.2.0.beta2 to 5.2.0.rc1 broke my master_key and credentials became unusable. After fixing the master key, or dropping the new `credentials` feature completely the solution that I proposed earlier still works.

For those who encounter the same problem: if you have this issue, then most probably your master_key changed.

issue.title: Cannot find auto-generated secret_key_base in development

repository.name: devise
repository.description: Flexible authentication solution for Rails with Warden.

issue.body:
A friend and I started a new project on Ruby 2.5.1, Rails 5.2.0, Devise 4.4.3

When I cloned the project, I was unable to run any rails/rake tasks, since Devise was not able to find the key.

The intent is that Rails will automatically set `SECRET_KEY_BASE` for you in dev and test: [link to merge](https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/30067/files#diff-580e183141be706162224ef696bdb6c7R413)

I see that [activity](
https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/pull/4712) has been made in the past few months around hunting down the `SECRET_KEY_BASE` but it seems that there is still a small bit more to go:

Currently Devise's [Secret Key Finder](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/blob/master/lib/devise/secret_key_finder.rb) is unable to find the autogenerated key. Rails only does "auto generation" of the key in `Rails.application.secret_key_base` which is not currently checked.

@jcoyne mentioned this in https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/issues/4710#issuecomment-347624819 but it seems that the current implementation doesn't take into account `Rails.application.secret_key_base` -- the only autogenerated version in dev/test for Rails 5.2


```
[7] pry(main)> Rails.application.credentials.secret_key_base
=> nil
[8] pry(main)> Rails.application.secrets.secret_key_base
=> nil
[9] pry(main)> Rails.application.config.secret_key_base
=> nil
[10] pry(main)> Rails.application.secret_key_base
=> "d56814a3585e59378bbcabc1467d2693"
```

- [Rails.application.secret_key_base - not checked in devise](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/railties/lib/rails/application.rb#L428)


The [help message for this error mentions to hardcode a secret key string into the initializer](https://github.com/plataformatec/devise/blob/f220b992c338122226f6fd396056d5a1adf28df8/lib/generators/templates/devise.rb#L11), which would affect all environments. For anyone who comes across this issue until this is better handled, a more appropriate option is to use

```ruby
  config.secret_key = Rails.application.secret_key_base
```

body: In my case I believe it's the gem devise_auth_token that overrides my config.secret configuration. Renaming devise.rb to zdevise.rb or something likewise did the trick.

you can try this (config/secrets.yml):

development:
  secret_key_base: 83aa0c7d6e2ed4574099514eb64bc3896fb8a71a344935fbd54705e0dd65adb897bc062fe477d03395a4d65675c833ba73ed340166be3874bfc01f43d6076385

test:
  secret_key_base: 513fb7657945b56098db290394bf23f5e11463c473fb228719428a30fd34b8b899dff3f6173c32d7e6bc028dc3276f15dcba11b684d27983d8203fb5634ce8ae

# Do not keep production secrets in the repository,
# instead read values from the environment.
production:
  secret_key_base: <%= ENV["SECRET_KEY_BASE"] %>
